sections.title: Manuscripts should be received by 1 April 1987.
paragraphs: For information write to: Department of Linguistics University of Sidney NSW Australia 2006 ANNOUNCEMENTS
FOURTH CONFERENCE ON ARABIC COMPUTATIONAL LINGUISTICS

sections.title: 15-19 March 1987, University of
paragraphs: Tunis The Linguistics Department of the Social and Economic Research and Study Center in Tunis is organising this conference in collaboration with the Computer Science Department of the FSEG-Faculty, Sfax, the Faculty of Arts in Tunis and the IBLV of Tunis. For further information, contact
Dr. Ridha SOUISSI
C.E.R.E.S.
23 rue d'Espagne
1000 Tunis Recette principale
telephone (+216) 248 053 ICCH 1987
EIGHTH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON COMPUTERS AND THE HUMANITIES

sections.title: 9-12 April 1987, University of South Carolina, Columbia, South Carolina
paragraphs: The Association for Computers and the Humanities and the Department of Computer Science of the University of South Carolina are pleased to announce the Eighth International Conference on Computers and the Humanities, to be held on Palm Sunday weekend to coincide with academic variations in North America and abroad. For further information, contact
ICCH87
c/o Professor Robert L. Oakman
Department of Computer Science
University of South Carolina
Cqlumbia, SC 29208, USA AILA SYDNEY 1987 EIGHTH WORLD CONGRESS OF APPLIED LINGUISTICS

sections.title: 16-21 August 1987, University of Sydney, Australia
paragraphs: STUDIES IN NATURAL LANGUAGE PROCESSING Two new books in the Cambridge University Press series have just been published: Computational Linguistics: An Introduction by Ralph Grishman; and Language and Spatial Cognition: An Interdisciplinary Study of Prepositions in English by Annette Herskovits. Semantic Interpretation and the Resolution of Ambiguity by Graeme Hirst is expected shortly. Books under contract and in various stages of production are: Machine Translation - Theoretical and Methodological Issues by Sergei Nirenburg; an English translation of Generation automatique de textes en langues naturelles by Laurence Danlos; Generalized Phrase Structure Grammars - Head Grammars and Natural Languages by Carl Pollard. [UPDATE: In addition, one contract offer has been made and five manuscripts are under review.]
Manuscripts and editorial inquiries should be sent to
Aravind Joshi
Computer and Information Science
University of Pennsylvania
Philadelphia, PA 19104, USA
joshi@upenn.csnet. Information for ordering is provided at the end of this issue. COLING '86 PROCEEDINGS
